intro: Gynoxys glabrata, commonly known as the smooth gynoxys, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are often pink or red in color. Gynoxys glabrata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
